thread.title: No doubt whom Stanton will be rooting for
thread.title_full: No doubt whom Stanton will be rooting for

title: No doubt whom Stanton will be rooting for
text:
No doubt whom Stanton will be rooting for No doubt whom Stanton will be rooting for Post to Facebook No doubt whom Stanton will be rooting for No doubt whom Stanton will be rooting for  //www.hometownlife.com/story/sports/2015/10/13/doubt-stanton-will-rooting/73884324/   Join the Conversation To   No doubt whom Stanton will be rooting for Dan O'Meara Staff Writer 6:19 p.m. EDT October 13, 2015 Former Harrison and MSU quarterback Drew Stanton does an interview during his Tuesday appearance. (Photo: DAN O’MEARA) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
During a Tuesday visit to Farmington Hills and his alma mater, Harrison High School, former Michigan State quarterback Drew Stanton talked about the undefeated Spartans, too. 
Despite being 6-0, they have been dropping in the national polls following close wins over Purdue and Rutgers. The Spartans were No. 2 and have slid to No. 7. 
“I’m not worried about it,” he said. “At the end of the year, all that matters is how many you have in the win column. 
“Sometimes, you don’t win pretty. As long as you’re winning football games, (that’s all that matters). 
“Coach (Mark) D’Antonio will be the first to tell you: ‘You have to overcome all that and win a football game.’” 
Stanton hopes to see the Spartans go to 7-0 this week with a win over arch rival and No. 12-ranked Michigan in Ann Arbor. Kickoff is set for 3:30 p.m. 
“Obviously, it’s a pressure weekend,” he said. “I can’t talk much, because we never beat (the Wolverines). 
“I have to keep my mouth shut during the week and ride the coattails of other people if we win. 
“Everybody always throws it back in my face. ‘You never beat them.’ So, touche!” 
The rivalry and the fact Michigan is on a roll, too, is good for the state of the game in the state, Stanton added. 
“It’s better overall for the state when we have this top-25 matchup and people are looking forward to it,” he said. “Hopefully, it’s a perfect fall Saturday, and you can go in and support your team. 
“Obviously, (U-M coach) Jim Harbaugh is doing a tremendous job and it speaks for itself. He’s done that everywhere he’s gone. He’s got those kids believing, and that’s half the battle.” 
Stanton was at Harrison to support the Taylor Haugen Foundation and its YESS (Youth Equipment for Sports Safety) program. 
The foundation donated EvoShield body protection equipment to the Harrison football program. Stanton wears the same pads as an NFL quarterback for the Arizona Cardinals. Read or Share this story: http://www.hometownlife.com/story/sports/2015/10/13/doubt-stanton-will-rooting/73884324/ TOP VIDEOS
